attributes.action: Speed up NHS Approval of Semaglutide diabetes drug to  within 12 months time
attributes.additional_details:
'Type 2 diabetes has become one of the greatest challenges facing the NHS. These latest results are hugely encouraging 
It works by stimulating the production of insulin and suppressing f the  glucagon and lowers appetite. 
Over 600  given semaglutide orally  monitored over 26 weeks.
As well as the weight loss benefits, reductions of up to 1.9 per cent on average of HbA1c -
Nearly nine tenths of patients receiving oral semaglutide achieved the target HbA1c level of less than 7 per cent.
attributes.background:

Oct 18, 2017	Novo Nordisk Receives Positive 16-0 vote from FDA (US)Advisory Committee in Favor of Approval for Semaglutide

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for the running of clinical trials. Before any new medicine can be used to treat people in the UK, it goes through a strictly monitored development process. 

You can find out more here: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/medicines-information/#how-new-medicines-become-available

You can follow up dates on the approval process of Semaglutide here: https://www.sps.nhs.uk/medicines/semaglutide/

You could ask the UK Government to fund more research into treatments for type 2 diabetes, if that's what you want to happen.
